greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of k's such that A002034(k) = n.
link: Paul Erdős, S. W. Graham, Alexsandr Ivić, and Carl Pomerance, On the number of divisors of n!, Analytic Number Theory, Proceedings of a Conference in Honor of Heini Halberstam, ed. by B. C. Berndt, H. G. Diamond, A. J. Hildebrand, Birkhauser 1996, pp. 337-355.
J. Sondow and E. W. Weisstein, MathWorld: Smarandache Function
formula: a(n) = A027423(n)-A027423(n-1) = A000005(A000142(n))-A000005(A000142(n-1)) i.e., number of divisors of n! which are not divisors of (n-1)! [for n>1]. - _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 22 2001
Erdős, Graham, Ivić, & Pomerance show that the average order of log a(n) is c log n/(log log n)^2 with c around 0.6289. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 21 2015
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_
